name: crustily

crustily adverb
(HARD LAYER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that has a hard outer layer: The crustily pan-fried salmon was absolutely delicious. French citizens in the rural South eat baguettes just as crustily delicious as those eaten in Paris.

crustily adverb
(EASILY ANNOYED)
If you say that people, especially older people, do something crustily, you mean that they are complaining and are easily annoyed: "You don't need to come round if you don't have time," she replied, a little crustily. News coverage of last week's devastating fires showed some older residents crustily refusing to evacuate.
More examplesFewer examplesI felt sorry for the poor gardener whose hard work in my grandfather's garden was so crustily dismissed.He whistled for a few minutes, and then said crustily, "I am going to sea - you may go home if you don't want to join me!"
